title: Dow Jones Nearly Erases 250-Point Loss In Post-Coronavirus Stock Market Rally; Covid-19 Tester Soars 31% On FDA News
summary:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 250 points Monday morning before nearly erasing that loss midday, as the post-coronavirus stock market rally continues.
Dow Jones stock Intel (INTC) moved up 1.3% and was one of the top performers on the Dow 30.
Within the current stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again positive for 2020 and is up 1.7% through Friday's close.
Coronavirus Stock Market RallyAccording to IBD's The Big Picture, the stock market continues to strengthen after hitting lows over a month ago on March 23.
Stock Market News: Tesla, Under ArmourTesla stock slid more than 3% before turning nearly unchanged amid a variety of news for the electric-auto maker.
text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 250 points Monday morning before nearly erasing that loss midday, as the post-coronavirus stock market rally continues. Dow Jones stocks Apple and Microsoft are above new buy points, while coronavirus test maker Quidel soared as much as 31% on FDA news.

X

Tech giants Apple (AAPL) and Microsoft (MSFT) rallied 1% and 0.7%, respectively, in today's stock market. Dow Jones stock Intel (INTC) moved up 1.3% and was one of the top performers on the Dow 30. Tesla (TSLA) fell 1.5% on weak China sales, while Under Armour (UAA) tumbled 10% on earnings. Coronavirus tester Quidel (QDEL) soared as much as 31% on FDA emergency-use approval.

Dow Jones Today: Coronavirus Tester Soars

The Nasdaq composite reversed from early losses and into a 0.8% gain Monday midday. At around 1 p.m. ET, the S&P 500 gained 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrials lost 0.2%.

Late Friday, the Food and Drug Administration granted emergency use authorization for Quidel's first antigen test for the Covid-19 virus.

Quidel stock soared as much as 31% in midday trade. Shares are at all-time highs. The coronavirus tester gained more than 171% in 2020 at Monday's peak price of 208.65.

Among exchange traded funds, Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) traded up 1.1% Monday morning. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 15% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (QQQ) moved up 0.6%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (SPY) ETF inched higher.

Within the current stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again positive for 2020 and is up 1.7% through Friday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 9.3% and 14.7%, respectively, through May 8.

IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis

Coronavirus News: Global Covid-19 Cases Top 4.2 Million

The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the Worldometer data tracker, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases is approaching 1.4 million Monday. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is steady amid the sharp increase in testing. On Sunday, there were about 20,000 new confirmed cases, the lowest daily figure since March 29.

Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed above 4.2 million, with more than 280,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases steady, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.

Coronavirus Stock Market Rally

According to IBD's The Big Picture, the stock market continues to strengthen after hitting lows over a month ago on March 23. The major stock indexes confirmed a new uptrend on April 2.

According to Friday's Big Picture, "There's been growing talk lately of a disconnect between the stock market and the economy. This is true, but keep in mind that the stock market is always looking ahead. The strong rally off lows is the market's way of saying the market sees better times ahead for the U.S. economy."

Stocks to watch include the top stocks on IBD Long-Term Leaders. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.

Post-Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend

Dow Jones News: Intel

Dow Jones chip giant Intel shrugged off the early stock market weakness with a 1.1% gain after the Wall Street Journal reported that Intel and Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) are in talks with the White House to build new chip plants in the U.S.

Intel shares are approaching a 62.23 buy point in a cup with handle.

According to the IBD Stock Checkup, Intel stock boasts a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating, placing it in the top echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.

Stock Market News: Tesla, Under Armour

Tesla stock slid more than 3% before turning nearly unchanged amid a variety of news for the electric-auto maker. Over the weekend, CEO Elon Musk threatened to move the company's operations out of California due to Alameda County's coronavirus shutdown order. Tesla's Fremont auto plant remains shut down.

Meanwhile, Tesla's China sales dove 64% in April vs. March, according to the China Passenger Car Association. For April, Tesla sold 3,635 cars after selling more than 10,100 in March amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Tesla shares are once again above a cup with handle's 775.05 buy point. On May 1, the stock's breakout failed after Musk tweeted the stock price was "too high."

Under Armour plunged after missing Q1 earnings and sales estimates early Monday. Under Armour lost 34 cents a share while sales measured $930.2 million.

Shares of the retailer tumbled more than 10% and are more than 70% off their 52-week high.

Dow Jones Leaders: Apple, Microsoft

Dow Jones leader Apple stock looked to extend a five-day win streak that saw the stock moved beyond the 5% buy zone of a cup-with-handle's 288.35 buy point, according to MarketSmith chart analysis. The 5% buy range goes up to 302.77.

Apple stock gained 1% early Monday. The iPhone maker is an IBD Leaderboard member. According to Leaderboard commentary, "The stock broke out in soft volume but that can happen sometimes with megacaps. The relative strength line is at new highs, a plus. The base is second stage." Apple stock has a 91 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating.

Meanwhile, tech giant Microsoft moved up 0.5% Monday morning, on pace to extend a five-day win streak. Shares are still in the buy range past a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. The buy zone runs up to 189.11. Microsoft is also an IBD Leaderboard stock idea and an IBD Long-Term Leader.

Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a double bottom, according to MarketSmith chart analysis.

Be sure to follow Scott Lehtonen on Twitter at @IBD_SLehtonen for more on growth stocks and the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/lehtonens/" title="Posts by SCOTT LEHTONEN" class="author url fn" rel="author">SCOTT LEHTONEN</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">01:05 PM ET 05/11/2020</li>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 250 points Monday morning before nearly erasing that loss midday, as the post-coronavirus stock market rally continues. <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/dow-jones-stocks/">Dow Jones stocks</a> Apple and Microsoft are above new buy points, while coronavirus test maker Quidel soared as much as 31% on FDA news.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5811015" vid-dom-id="5811015-5ebb5f603d7f1" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/CTNziq9S.m3u8" data-captions="" vid-name="Stocks Close Strong; Vertex, Ping Identity, ResMed Clear Buy Points" vid-cat="Stock Market Today" vid-date="05/11/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/CTNziq9S-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5811015-5ebb5f603d7f1" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stocks Close Strong; Vertex, Ping Identity, ResMed Clear Buy Points","description":"Stocks close strong, led by growth; Vertex, Ping Identity, ResMed clear buy points.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/CTNziq9S-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/CTNziq9S.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-05-11T13:54:21+0000","duration":"PT374.49S","author":"ALISSA CORAM, Ed Carson","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>Tech giants <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) and <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>) rallied 1% and 0.7%, respectively, in <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">today's stock market.</a> Dow Jones stock <strong>Intel</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=INTC' target='_blank'>INTC</a>) moved up 1.3% and was one of the top performers on the Dow 30. <b>Tesla</b> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSLA' target='_blank'>TSLA</a>) fell 1.5% on weak China sales, while <strong>Under Armour</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=UAA' target='_blank'>UAA</a>) tumbled 10% on earnings. Coronavirus tester <strong>Quidel</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=QDEL' target='_blank'>QDEL</a>) soared as much as 31% on FDA emergency-use approval.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Today: Coronavirus Tester Soars</h2>
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/stock-market-data-dow-jones-sp-500-nasdaq-spdr-etfs/">Nasdaq composite</a> reversed from early losses and into a 0.8% gain Monday midday. At around 1 p.m. ET, the S&P 500 gained 0.2%, while the Dow Jones industrials lost 0.2%.</p>
<p>Late Friday, the Food and Drug Administration granted emergency use authorization for Quidel's first antigen test for the Covid-19 virus.</p>
<p>Quidel stock soared as much as 31% in midday trade. Shares are at all-time highs. The coronavirus tester gained more than 171% in 2020 at Monday's peak price of 208.65.</p>
<script type="text/javascript">

<div class="investors-tickers-data-table" id="investors-tickers-data-table-4752222-1589337952"></div>
<p>Among <a href="https://www.investors.com/ibd-indexes/ibd-etf-indexes-ibd-50-etf-leaders-breakout-stocks-etf-ffty-ldrs-bout/">exchange traded funds</a>, Innovator IBD 50 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=FFTY' target='_blank'>FFTY</a>) traded up 1.1% Monday morning. The ETF of top growth stocks is about 15% off its 52-week high. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq 100-linked Invesco QQQ Trust ETF (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=QQQ' target='_blank'>QQQ</a>) moved up 0.6%, and the SPDR S&P 500 (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=SPY' target='_blank'>SPY</a>) ETF inched higher.</p>
<p>Within the current stock market rally, the tech-heavy Nasdaq is once again positive for 2020 and is up 1.7% through Friday's close. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average are down 9.3% and 14.7%, respectively, through May 8.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><strong><a href="https://shop.investors.com/offer/splashresponsive.aspx?id=IBD-Live&src=A00433A&refcode=pdsoc%7Cggl%7Cibdlive%7C2019%7C11%7Cibdlive%7Cna%7C985802&intcode=invstcntnartcls|cms|ibdlive|2019|11|ibdlive|na|682843">IBD Live: A New Tool For Daily Stock Market Analysis</a></strong></p>
<hr />
<h2>Coronavirus News: Global Covid-19 Cases Top 4.2 Million</h2>
<p>The coronavirus outbreak continues to spread across the U.S. According to the <a href="https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Worldometer data tracker</a>, the cumulative number of confirmed U.S. cases is approaching 1.4 million Monday. Despite the rising total, the daily number of new cases is steady amid the sharp increase in testing. On Sunday, there were about 20,000 new confirmed cases, the lowest daily figure since March 29.</p>
<p>Confirmed Covid-19 cases worldwide climbed above 4.2 million, with more than 280,000 virus-related deaths. With the daily number of new cases steady, investors in the U.S. are turning attention to the economic impact of the coronavirus outbreak and how fast the country reopens for business.</p>
<h2>Coronavirus Stock Market Rally</h2>
<p>According to IBD's <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">The Big Picture</a>, the stock market continues to strengthen after hitting lows over a month ago on March 23. The major stock indexes confirmed a new uptrend on April 2.</p>
<p>According to Friday's <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/the-big-picture/stock-market-rally-finds-another-gear-nasdaq-rises-above-9000-despite-weak-jobs-data/">Big Picture</a>, "There's been growing talk lately of a disconnect between the stock market and the economy. This is true, but keep in mind that the stock market is always looking ahead. The strong rally off lows is the market's way of saying the market sees better times ahead for the U.S. economy."</p>
<p>Stocks to watch include the top stocks on <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leaders</a>. The IBD Long-Term Leaders list focuses on companies with stable earnings growth and price performance.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/ibds-etf-market-strategy/ibds-etf-market-strategy/"><strong>Post-Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Dow Jones News: Intel</h2>
<p>Dow Jones chip giant Intel shrugged off the early stock market weakness with a 1.1% gain after the Wall Street Journal reported that Intel and <strong>Taiwan Semiconductor</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=TSM' target='_blank'>TSM</a>) are in talks with the White House to build new chip plants in the U.S.</p>
<p>Intel shares are approaching a 62.23 buy point in a cup with handle.</p>
<p>According to the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/">IBD Stock Checkup</a>, <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-intel-corp-intc.aspx">Intel stock</a> boasts a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>, placing it in the top echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.</p>
<h2>Stock Market News: Tesla, Under Armour</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=TSLA'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Tesla stock slid more than 3% before turning nearly unchanged amid a variety of news for the electric-auto maker. Over the weekend, CEO Elon Musk threatened to move the company's operations out of California due to Alameda County's coronavirus shutdown order. Tesla's Fremont auto plant remains shut down.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, Tesla's China sales dove 64% in April vs. March, according to the China Passenger Car Association. For April, Tesla sold 3,635 cars after selling more than 10,100 in March amid the coronavirus outbreak.</p>
<p>Tesla shares are once again above a cup with handle's 775.05 buy point. On May 1, the stock's breakout failed after Musk tweeted the stock price was "too high."</p>
<p>Under Armour plunged after missing <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/under-armour-earnings-q1-2020-under-armour-stock/">Q1 earnings and sales estimates</a> early Monday. Under Armour lost 34 cents a share while sales measured $930.2 million.</p>
<p>Shares of the retailer tumbled more than 10% and are more than 70% off their 52-week high.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Leaders: Apple, Microsoft</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=AAPL'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Dow Jones leader Apple stock looked to extend a five-day win streak that saw the stock moved beyond the 5% buy zone of a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup-with-handle's</a> 288.35 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith chart analysis</a>. The 5% buy range goes up to 302.77.</p>
<p>Apple stock gained 1% early Monday. The iPhone maker is an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> member. According to Leaderboard commentary, "The stock broke out in soft volume but that can happen sometimes with megacaps. The relative strength line is at new highs, a plus. The base is second stage." <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-apple-inc-aapl.aspx">Apple stock</a> has a 91 out of a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>.</p>
<p>Meanwhile, tech giant Microsoft moved up 0.5% Monday morning, on pace to extend a five-day win streak. Shares are still in the buy range past a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. The buy zone runs up to 189.11. Microsoft is also an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> stock idea and an <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leader</a>.</p>
<p>Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/what-is-double-bottom-base-biotech-stocks/">double bottom</a>, according to<a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith"> MarketSmith chart analysis</a>.</p>
